ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Definitely recommend it. Your homework is to watch really interesting iconic films.
If you have any interest in Latin American cinema, definitely take this course! It's a great survey and you will have a very comprehensive understanding of the subject.

While Professor Tortora is a very sweet and passionate professor, this course actually ended up being a lot more work than I anticipated, mostly because all films have to be watched outside of class and there are a lot of short papers and assignments that you have to work on independently throughout the year. If you are very interested in film then it is probably a good course to take, but if you're just looking to satisfy an L5 requirement you're probably better off with another option.
I would absolutely recommend it to a fellow student because it offers something that no other class in the Spanish department does.
watching movies and analyzing their historical context and the technical aspects. I would definitely recommend.
Focuses on older spanish movies but a good course!
I would recommend it if you are ready to do the work - very rewarding if you are.
I would recommend the course - it's a handy way to learn Spanish, Latin American history, and film in one fell swoop.
